info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 5:03AM PDT until September 01 at 8:15AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 815 AM MST /815 AM PDT/. * At 503 AM MST /503 AM PDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain in Boulder City. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boulder City, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Boulder Beach Campground, Hoover Dam, Boulder Beach, Railroad Pass, Las Vegas Bay Campground, Callville Bay, Callville Bay Campground Willow Beach and Black Mtn. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
